pr_title: Use new profile parameter to select routing profile

timeline.message: Make sure profiles are configured for every test
Throw an error when there is a routing request with no profile and start fixing tests
Make vehicle an instance variable in Measurement
Adjust a few more tests in GraphHopperIT
Error if vehicle/weighting is still set on GHRequest, tests failing mostly because request is manipulated
Actually select CH/LM profiles by name, remove Weighting#matches, many todos left

timeline.bodyText:
To improve readability also in tests we could remove the comments and reuse the previously defined variable carWithoutTurnCosts="profile1" instead of just "profile1"?
And why are the assertMoscowEdge/NodeBased calls removed? Because it is expected to work once the converter is tested?
timeline.author: karussell

replies.bodyText:
To improve readability also in tests we could remove the comments and reuse the previously defined variable carWithoutTurnCosts="profile1" instead of just "profile1"?

Yes. Good point.

And why are the assertMoscowEdge/NodeBased calls removed? Because it is expected to work once the converter is tested?

They weren't removed, but only inlined, because it no longer made sense to re-use the code in this method
replies.author: easbar

timeline.bodyText: Yes to both :) ? (profile should be in hints as long as the DefaultWeightingFactory gets only the HintsMap)
timeline.author: karussell

timeline.bodyText: Why is this necessary? The only exception should be the key parameter that should go into the URL.
timeline.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: Ok at some point I thought it would be useful to have profile as url parameter, so one can quickly decide (without looking at the request body) what kind of profile was requested (e.g. when filtering requests).
replies.author: easbar

timeline.bodyText: We did this for backward compatibility but we should probably not do this anymore and just ensure that the created profiles follow a certain standard (lower case and no spaces etc)
timeline.author: karussell

timeline.message: Remove profile url parameter for POST
Reset entire branch to profile_parameter2 branch
Replace vehicle/weighting parameters with profile parameter in GET /route
Implement profile parameter in RouteResource and GraphHopperWeb, use it in tests
Adjusts a few more tests with missing profile
Change hints map to pmap in block area
Add integration for profile selection using profile or legacy parameters
Fix broken url for get requests

Merge branch 'master' into p3

No longer allow legacy parameters when profile parameter is used
A few more tests and fixes

timeline.bodyText:
I wonder if we should remove get/SetVehicle/Weighting from HintsMap now? The problem is that when using GraphHopper as a Java library we pass GHRequest including a HintsMap to GraphHopper#route, but this method no longer accepts weighting/vehicle but needs a profile instead. On the other hand when we use GHRequest on the client side via GraphHopperWeb one can still use vehicle/weighting due to the ProfileResolver in the RouteResource (even though also here profile is the recommended parameter now). We could also  copy&paste GHRequest and HintsMap on the client side and adjust both versions accordingly, but I do not see a real reason to keep vehicle/weighting? When someone is updating the client version there will be a compile error and he/she will be forced to replace setVehicle/Weighting with setProfile, but is this a problem? Using older clients still works of course (because of ProfileResolver).
Update: This is what it would look like without HintsMap: d2cc097. Maybe we could extract a constant for "vehicle" and "weighting", but otherwise I do not see a reason not to remove it at the moment.
timeline.author: easbar

replies.bodyText:
When someone is updating the client version there will be a compile error and he/she will be forced to replace setVehicle/Weighting with setProfile, but is this a problem?

In general this would be nice to have. Could we even remove HintsMap completely (replace with PMap)?
And I see hints().putObject("vehicle", "bike") is still possible so removing this should not be a problem. (E.g. we might not be fast enough to accept "profile" in the public API)
replies.author: karussell

replies.bodyText:
In general this would be nice to have. Could we even remove HintsMap completely (replace with PMap)?

Absolutely I already did this here: d2cc097
replies.author: easbar

timeline.bodyText: I guess this is so because the POST endpoint does not support gpx and we can leave as is here?
timeline.author: easbar

replies.bodyText:
Ah, good catch. I think we should always prefer POST as the request is optionally compressed and has no other limitations (?)

looks like our POST endpoint does not support gpx yet?

doPost should support it or why do you think it does not?
replies.author: karussell

replies.bodyText:
doPost should support it or why do you think it does not?

Hm, yes you are right it should already support it. Ok then we should make GraphHopperWeb#export respect the postRequest flag. If I do this the test fails, but maybe thats for another issue. -> #1994
replies.author: easbar

timeline.bodyText: Do you remember the reason this is done here instead of in GraphHopper? Can we move it over now?
timeline.author: easbar

replies.bodyText: Good question. I do not remember a reason why this is here.
replies.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: Maybe for backward compatibility? Is it ok to add these checks for POST as well? If yes we can move them into GraphHopper#calcPaths.
replies.author: easbar

replies.bodyText: But there is more: Also the enableElevation, pointsEmpty checks and the "start heading" logic is missing for POST? All this should probably go into GraphHopper#calcPaths as well? Maybe this is also for another issue? -> #1996
replies.author: easbar

replies.bodyText: Should be good for POST too, yes. Good idea with the new issue.
replies.author: karussell

timeline.author: easbar

replies.bodyText: I would indeed probably keep it until 2.0?
replies.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: For GET its already contained in httpReq.getQueryString(). Same for algoStr, but I added it explicitly now.
replies.author: easbar

timeline.bodyText: @easbar for better readability IMO we should use milliseconds: + took/1000f + "ms...? (or just Math.round(took/1000))
timeline.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: Ok micros might still be a bit too optimistic ;) I changed to millisecond with one decimal place
replies.author: easbar
